main event: Multiple sightings of a high-velocity white light which seemed to taper downward from an oval shape were reported in Texas and New Mexico in November 1957.
interesting points: The object was observed by multiple individuals and seemed to be moving downward in the west to east direction.
It appeared to be thirty-five degrees above the horizon and had an azimuth of two hundred twenty degrees.
Although the sightings were classified as unusual, no conclusion could be drawn as to the origin of the objects.
The document mentioned that a correspondent had photographic equipment but failed to use it in time as the object was disappearing.
Venus, the only planet visible in the evening sky, was prominent and appeared brighter than any other star.
witnesses: multiple individuals including a correspondent and members of the U.S. Border Patrol
photographs: no photographs included in the document
